examples.translation: Raise your hand if you want to answer.

glosses: to make (someone) stand up; to get someone up (from bed)

examples.text: Kaldır babanı. Yoksa işe geç kalacak.
examples.translation: Get your dad up. Otherwise he'll be late for work.

glosses: to remove, take away, to put something away or out of reach
to bear, endure, tolerate (someone's words or behavior)
to swipe, make off with, steal, lift
to be able to run or operate a software, video game etc.

examples.translation: I don't think that your computer is capable of running this game.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish قالدرمق (kaldırmak, “to lift up, raise, pick up, set up, erect, carry, wake up, take away, abrogate”), causative form of Proto-Turkic *Kal(ï)- (“to rise, jump up”). Clauson thinks the Turkish form is rather crasis of *kalk-tur-, where -tur is causative suffix. See kalkmak.
